pages.text: Palaeoisopus is a large sea spider. Each margin of its body was covered by tubercles and the head is defined by ring like segmentation. Its large eyes and oar like legs suggest a nektonic visual predator, that may have preyed on crinoids.
$(l)Eats:$() Fish Food$(br)$(l)Breeds with:$() Fish Food$(br)$(l)Egg Type:$() Drops Egg$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Bucket
